com.adidas.ui.design.widget

Class NewTextInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.adidas.ui.design.widget.NewTextInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NewEmailInput, NewPasswordInput

    public class NewTextInput
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    Supercharged EditText, with a label, guidance, error view, action button and loading state. To move from one state to another is produced by entering new characters or changing the focus of the view. These are the defined states: - empty and out fo focus - empty and focused - not empty, focused, and not validated - correctly validated (not empty, and no matter if focused or not) - error validated (not empty, no matter if focused or not)

    Guidance is available and it can be static or dynamic. Static guidance is just and static text defines by setStaticGuidance or xml att and shows a text below, while the user has the view focused and not validated. Dynamic guide can be set via setGuide method. It can change according to the text entered by the user and it is used, when going to validated state, to decide if the TextInput goes to success or error state.

    Guide.guide() is used to update the guidance text while Guide.validate() is used to validate input and go to error state or success state, showing the error message if needed.

    An error message ca also be set from the outside via setErrorMessage();

    ActionButton doesn't do anything unless a listener is set.

    It is possible to show loading via setProgressIndeterminate();

        public void setError(java.lang.String errorMessage,

        Parameters:

        animate - if the animation should be performed
